verbs.description: brighten (third-person singular simple present brightens, present participle brightening, simple past and past participle brightened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make bright or brighter in color.
examples: We brightened the room with a new coat of paint.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make illustrious, or more distinguished; to add luster or splendor to
(transitive, figuratively) To make more cheerful and pleasant; to enliven
examples: to brighten one's prospects;  Having Mark around the place really brightens things up.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To grow bright, or more bright in color; to clear up
examples: The sun starts to brighten around this time of the year.  The sky brightened as the storm moved on.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become brighter or more cheerful in mood
examples: She brightened when I changed the subject.
